page.title: 09CLUBS IN WEDMORE AND AREA
page.content: Country interests are still pursued in the Wedmore area in the preserving club which protects and regulates game and meets of the hunt at the local inns. Sports include a cricket club which played around a tree 135 years ago, football, tennis and badminton, and a new bowling green promised next year. Arts, crafts and drama, yoga and keep fit, bridge and bell-ringing thrive as do many other clubs. Interest in the area is encouraged by the Isle of Wedmore Society. Groups for the young include the Young Farmers, established for over half a century, Guides, Scouts, Brownies, Cubs and a youth club. The play school provides displays together with St. Mary's and Wedmore First School.
